- [ ] Basic undo/redo (Vimflowy's history system)

**Deliverable**: Working Vimflowy clone with CRDT sync in 5 days

## Phase 2: Persistence & UI (Days 6-8) üöÄ
**Goal**: File operations and polished interface
**Agent Multiplier**: 4x (Eliza OS integration + agent-generated UI)

### Day 6: Storage Layer (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] PGlite integration (agent-generated from specs)
- [ ] Document save/load (agent-generated persistence layer)
- [ ] Plaintext import/export (agent-generated converters)
- [ ] Auto-save with CRDT (agent-generated auto-save logic)

### Day 7-8: UI Polish (Agent-Generated + Eliza OS)
- [ ] Zoom animations with vignetting (agent-generated animations)
- [ ] Panel system implementation (agent-generated UI components)
- [ ] Keyboard shortcuts (port Vimflowy's keybinding system)
- [ ] Command palette (agent-generated command system)
- [ ] Breadcrumb navigation (agent-generated from specs)

**Deliverable**: Functional single-user knowledge base in 3 days

## Phase 3: Canvas & Properties (Days 9-12) üöÄ
**Goal**: Spatial view and metadata
**Agent Multiplier**: 3x (Agent-generated WebGL + property system)

### Day 9-10: Canvas Mode (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Canvas renderer with WebGL (agent-generated WebGL setup)
- [ ] Node positioning and dragging (agent-generated interaction system)
- [ ] Edge creation (agent-generated edge system)
- [ ] Canvas persistence (agent-generated canvas storage)
- [ ] Switch between document/canvas (agent-generated mode switching)

### Day 11-12: Property System (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Property editor UI (agent-generated property components)
- [ ] Tags and aliases (agent-generated tagging system)
- [ ] Search by properties (agent-generated property search)
- [ ] Custom property types (agent-generated type system)
- [ ] Property-based views (agent-generated view system)

**Deliverable**: Document + Canvas with rich metadata in 4 days

## Phase 4: Intelligence Layer (Days 13-16) üöÄ
**Goal**: Embeddings and semantic search
**Agent Multiplier**: 4x (Agent-generated AI integration)

### Day 13-14: Vector Search (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Local embedding generation (agent-generated embedding service)
- [ ] pgvector setup (agent-generated vector database)
- [ ] Semantic search UI (agent-generated search interface)
- [ ] Similar node suggestions (agent-generated similarity system)

### Day 15-16: Basic Intelligence (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Auto-tagging (agent-generated tagging AI)
- [ ] Smart links (agent-generated link suggestion)
- [ ] Content suggestions (agent-generated content AI)
- [ ] Basic RAG queries (agent-generated RAG system)

**Deliverable**: AI-enhanced knowledge base in 4 days

## Phase 5: Plugin System (Days 17-20) üöÄ
**Goal**: Extensibility
**Agent Multiplier**: 3x (Agent-generated plugin architecture)

### Day 17-18: Rune Runtime (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Plugin API design (agent-generated API from specs)
- [ ] Rune integration (agent-generated Rune bindings)
- [ ] Plugin loading system (agent-generated plugin loader)
- [ ] Core plugin examples (agent-generated example plugins)

### Day 19-20: Plugin Development (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Plugin manager UI (agent-generated plugin management)
- [ ] Hot reload support (agent-generated hot reload)
- [ ] Plugin documentation (agent-generated docs)
- [ ] Security sandboxing (agent-generated sandbox)

**Deliverable**: Extensible platform in 4 days

## Phase 6: Agent Integration (Days 21-24) üöÄ
**Goal**: MCP and agent support
**Agent Multiplier**: 5x (Eliza OS A2A + agent-generated MCP)

### Day 21-22: MCP Server (Agent-Generated + Eliza OS)
- [ ] Crucible as MCP server (agent-generated MCP implementation)
- [ ] Tool definitions (agent-generated from specs)
- [ ] Resource exposure (agent-generated resource API)
- [ ] Prompt templates (agent-generated prompt system)

### Day 23-24: Agent Features (Eliza OS Integration)
- [ ] MCP client integration (Eliza OS A2A protocol)
- [ ] Agent UI components (agent-generated agent interface)
- [ ] Multi-agent workflows (Eliza OS workflow system)
- [ ] A2A protocol support (Eliza OS messaging adapters)

**Deliverable**: Agent-enhanced knowledge system in 4 days

## Phase 7: Visual Programming Interface (Days 25-28) üöÄ
**Goal**: Node-based workflow builder
**Agent Multiplier**: 4x (Agent-generated visual editor + A2A integration)

### Day 25-26: Node System (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Node editor framework (agent-generated canvas system)
- [ ] Node registry and types (agent-generated node system)
- [ ] Connection system (agent-generated data flow)
- [ ] Visual node rendering (agent-generated WebGL/Canvas)
- [ ] Drag & drop interface (agent-generated interactions)

### Day 27-28: A2A Workflow Integration (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Node-to-A2A mapping (agent-generated protocol bridge)
- [ ] Workflow execution engine (agent-generated executor)
- [ ] Visual debugging (agent-generated debugging UI)
- [ ] Template library (agent-generated workflow templates)
- [ ] Export/import functionality (agent-generated serialization)

**Deliverable**: Visual programming interface for agent workflows in 4 days

## Phase 8: Collaboration (Days 29-32) üöÄ
**Goal**: Multi-user support
**Agent Multiplier**: 3x (Agent-generated sync + Eliza OS messaging)

### Day 29-30: Sync Infrastructure (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] CRDT sync protocol (agent-generated sync layer)
- [ ] WebRTC setup (agent-generated WebRTC)
- [ ] Conflict visualization (agent-generated conflict UI)
- [ ] User presence (agent-generated presence system)

### Day 31-32: Collaboration Features (Eliza OS Integration)
- [ ] Shared workspaces (Eliza OS Discord/Telegram integration)
- [ ] Comments/annotations (agent-generated annotation system)
- [ ] Permission system (agent-generated permissions)
- [ ] Activity feed (Eliza OS messaging integration)

**Deliverable**: Collaborative knowledge base in 4 days

## Phase 8: Production (Days 29-32) üöÄ
**Goal**: Launch readiness
**Agent Multiplier**: 4x (Agent-generated optimization + deployment)

### Day 29-30: Performance (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Optimization pass (agent-generated performance fixes)
- [ ] Memory profiling (agent-generated profiling tools)
- [ ] Large document testing (agent-generated test suite)
- [ ] Mobile PWA (agent-generated PWA setup)

### Day 31-32: Polish (Agent-Generated)
- [ ] Onboarding flow (agent-generated onboarding)
- [ ] Documentation (agent-generated docs)
- [ ] Website (agent-generated marketing site)
- [ ] Distribution setup (agent-generated build pipeline)

**Deliverable**: Production-ready Crucible 1.0 in 4 days

## üöÄ **TOTAL TIMELINE: 32 DAYS (vs 32 weeks without agents)**

## üöÄ Speed Multiplication Strategies

### 1. **Agent Orchestration Architecture**

#### **Multi-Agent Workflows**
```yaml
# Agent Orchestration Pipeline
agents:
  - name: "code_generator"
    role: "Generate code from specs"
    tools: ["codebase_search", "write", "search_replace"]
    
  - name: "test_automation"
    role: "Generate and run tests"
    tools: ["run_terminal_cmd", "read_lints", "grep"]
    
  - name: "documentation_bot"
    role: "Maintain documentation"
    tools: ["read_file", "write", "codebase_search"]
    
  - name: "integration_specialist"
    role: "Handle Vimflowy/Eliza OS integration"
    tools: ["web_search", "codebase_search", "MultiEdit"]
```

#### **Parallel Agent Execution**
- **Code Generation**: 3-5 agents generating different components simultaneously
- **Testing**: Automated test generation and execution in parallel
- **Documentation**: Real-time documentation updates as code changes
- **Integration**: Dedicated agents for Vimflowy and Eliza OS adaptation

### 2. **Vimflowy Integration Strategy** (5x Speed Multiplier)

#### **Day 1: Direct Code Porting**
```bash
# Clone and extract Vimflowy patterns
git clone https://github.com/WuTheFWasThat/vimflowy.git vimflowy-source
cp -r vimflowy-source/src/assets/js/session ./src/core/
cp -r vimflowy-source/src/assets/js/keyBindings ./src/input/
cp -r vimflowy-source/src/assets/js/plugins ./plugins/
```

#### **Agent-Generated Adaptations**
- **MAC ID Conversion**: Agent converts numeric IDs to MAC addresses
- **Svelte Port**: Agent converts React components to Svelte 5
- **TypeScript Modernization**: Agent updates CoffeeScript to modern TypeScript
- **CRDT Integration**: Agent adds Yjs integration to Vimflowy patterns

### 3. **Eliza OS Integration Strategy** (4x Speed Multiplier)

#### **Messaging Platform Adapters**
```rust
// Agent-generated platform adapters
pub struct DiscordAdapter { /* Eliza OS Discord integration */ }
pub struct TelegramAdapter { /* Eliza OS Telegram integration */ }
pub struct SlackAdapter { /* Eliza OS Slack integration */ }
```

#### **A2A Protocol Integration**
- **Message Bridge**: Agent-generated bridge between Crucible and Eliza OS
- **File Storage**: Leverage Discord/Telegram for free file storage
- **Community Features**: Direct integration with platform communities

### 4. **Agent Code Generation Pipeline**

#### **Spec-Driven Development**
```yaml
# Agent Workflow
1. Read specification files
2. Generate code templates
3. Implement core functionality
4. Generate tests automatically
5. Update documentation
6. Run integration tests
7. Deploy and verify
```

#### **Template-Based Generation**
- **Rust Services**: Generate from `specs/rust-core/` specifications
- **Svelte Components**: Generate from `specs/svelte-frontend/` specs
- **Database Schemas**: Generate from `specs/database/` specifications
- **API Endpoints**: Generate from `specs/tauri-backend/` specs

### 5. **Continuous Integration with Agents**

#### **Automated Quality Gates**
```yaml
# Agent-Enabled CI/CD
on_push:
  - agent_generate_tests
  - agent_run_linting
  - agent_check_performance
  - agent_update_docs
  - agent_deploy_preview
```

#### **Real-Time Feedback Loop**
- **Code Quality**: Agents continuously improve code quality
- **Performance**: Agents optimize based on metrics
- **Documentation**: Agents keep docs in sync with code
- **Testing**: Agents generate comprehensive test coverage

### 6. **Recommended Agent Orchestration Tools**

#### **MCP (Model Context Protocol)**
```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "crucible-dev": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["mcp-server.js"],
      "env": {
        "CRUCIBLE_SPECS": "./specs"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

#### **Agent Coordination Patterns**
- **Sequential**: Code generation ‚Üí Testing ‚Üí Documentation
- **Parallel**: Multiple agents working on different components
- **Pipeline**: Output of one agent feeds into next
- **Feedback**: Agents learn from each other's outputs

### 7. **Speed Multiplication Techniques**

#### **Code Reuse Strategy**
- **Vimflowy Patterns**: 80% of UI/UX patterns ready to use
- **Eliza OS Integrations**: 90% of messaging/platform code ready
- **Yjs CRDT**: 100% of sync logic available
- **Tauri Framework**: 100% of desktop app structure ready

#### **Agent-Generated Boilerplate**
- **Project Setup**: 95% automated from specs
- **API Endpoints**: 90% generated from OpenAPI specs
- **Database Migrations**: 100% generated from schema specs
- **UI Components**: 80% generated from design specs

#### **Parallel Development Streams**
```
Stream 1: Core Editor (Vimflowy adaptation)
Stream 2: Storage Layer (PGlite integration)
Stream 3: Canvas Mode (WebGL implementation)
Stream 4: Agent Integration (Eliza OS A2A)
Stream 5: Plugin System (Rune runtime)
```

### 8. **Risk Mitigation with Agents**

#### **Automated Testing**
- **Unit Tests**: Generated for every function
- **Integration Tests**: Generated for every API endpoint
- **E2E Tests**: Generated for every user workflow
- **Performance Tests**: Generated for every component

#### **Quality Assurance**
- **Code Review**: Agents review each other's code
- **Linting**: Automated code quality checks
- **Security**: Automated vulnerability scanning
- **Documentation**: Automated documentation generation

## Immediate Next Steps

1. **Create GitHub repository**
   ```bash
   gh repo create crucible --public
   git init
   git remote add origin https://github.com/yourusername/crucible.git
   ```

2. **Initialize project**
   ```bash
   # Copy workspace structure
   cargo init --name crucible
   pnpm init
   
   # Set up workspaces
   mkdir -p crates packages plugins docs tests scripts
   ```

3. **First commit**
   ```bash
   git add .
   git commit -m "feat: Initialize Crucible knowledge management system"
   git push -u origin main
   ```

4. **Set up development environment**
   ```bash
   # Install dependencies
   cargo install tauri-cli
   cargo install cargo-watch
   
   # Run setup
   ./scripts/setup.sh
   ```

5. **Start with minimal viable feature**
   - Just get text editing working
   - Add nesting
   - Add zoom
   - Iterate from there

## Development Principles

1. **Ship early, ship often** - Get to usable quickly
2. **Dogfood immediately** - Use Crucible to document Crucible
3. **Performance first** - Profile before optimizing
4. **User feedback driven** - Share alpha early
5. **Plugin-ready architecture** - Even if plugins come later

## Risk Mitigation

### Technical Risks
- **CRDT complexity**: Start with simple text, add complex types later
- **Performance**: Profile early, use virtual scrolling
- **Canvas rendering**: Consider fallback to DOM if WebGL issues

### Product Risks
- **Feature creep**: Stick to roadmap, park ideas for 2.0
- **Over-engineering**: Ship MVP, iterate based on usage
- **Adoption**: Focus on power users first, expand later

## Success Metrics

### Phase 1-2: Foundation
- Can create 1000 nodes without lag
- Zoom animation at 60fps
- Zero data loss

### Phase 3-4: Features
- Semantic search < 100ms
- Canvas with 100 nodes at 60fps
- 5+ useful plugins shipped

### Phase 5-8: Scale
- Support 100k nodes
- 5 concurrent users without conflicts
- < 5s cold start time

## Community Building

1. **Open source from day 1**
2. **Weekly dev logs**
3. **Discord community**
4. **Plugin hackathons**
5. **Bounty program for contributions**

---

Ready to transform knowledge management? Let's build Crucible! üî•

# Crucible Agent-Enabled Development Roadmap

> **32-Day Timeline**: From concept to production with AI agent orchestration

## üöÄ **Speed Multipliers**

- **Vimflowy Integration**: 5x (Days 1-5) - Direct code adaptation
- **Eliza OS Integration**: 4x (Days 6-8, 21-24) - Agent coordination
- **Agent Code Generation**: 3-5x (All phases) - Automated development
- **Spec-Driven Development**: 4x (All phases) - Template-based generation

## üìÖ **Phase Overview**

| Phase | Days | Focus | Key Deliverable |
|-------|------|-------|-----------------|
| **Foundation** | 1-5 | Vimflowy adaptation + CRDT | Working outliner with sync |
| **Persistence** | 6-8 | Storage + UI polish | Functional knowledge base |
| **Canvas** | 9-12 | Spatial view + properties | Document + Canvas mode |
| **Intelligence** | 13-16 | AI + embeddings | AI-enhanced knowledge base |
| **Plugins** | 17-20 | Rune runtime + extensibility | Extensible platform |
| **Agents** | 21-24 | MCP + A2A protocol | Agent-enhanced system |
| **Collaboration** | 25-28 | Multi-user + sync | Collaborative knowledge base |
| **Production** | 29-32 | Optimization + deployment | Production-ready Crucible 1.0 |

## üèóÔ∏è **Component Roadmaps**

### **Rust Core**
- [Foundation](./rust-core-foundation.md) - CRDT + Vimflowy adaptation
- [Persistence](./rust-core-persistence.md) - Enhanced CRDT + sync
- [Canvas](./rust-core-canvas.md) - Spatial data structures
- [Intelligence](./rust-core-intelligence.md) - AI integration
- [Plugins](./rust-core-plugins.md) - Rune runtime
- [Agents](./rust-core-agents.md) - MCP + A2A
- [Collaboration](./rust-core-collaboration.md) - Real-time sync
- [Production](./rust-core-production.md) - Performance optimization

### **Tauri Backend**
- [Foundation](./tauri-backend-foundation.md) - Basic commands + IPC
- [Persistence](./tauri-backend-persistence.md) - File ops + storage
- [Canvas](./tauri-backend-canvas.md) - Canvas commands
- [Intelligence](./tauri-backend-intelligence.md) - AI service commands
- [Plugins](./tauri-backend-plugins.md) - Plugin management
- [Agents](./tauri-backend-agents.md) - Agent coordination
- [Collaboration](./tauri-backend-collaboration.md) - Multi-user support
- [Production](./tauri-backend-production.md) - Production deployment

### **Svelte Frontend**
- [Foundation](./svelte-frontend-foundation.md) - UI + Vimflowy adaptation
- [Persistence](./svelte-frontend-persistence.md) - UI polish + animations
- [Canvas](./svelte-frontend-canvas.md) - WebGL canvas
- [Intelligence](./svelte-frontend-intelligence.md) - Semantic search UI
- [Plugins](./svelte-frontend-plugins.md) - Plugin UI
- [Agents](./svelte-frontend-agents.md) - Agent workflows
- [Collaboration](./svelte-frontend-collaboration.md) - Collaboration UI
- [Production](./svelte-frontend-production.md) - PWA + mobile

### **Database Layer**
- [Foundation](./database-foundation.md) - PGlite + basic persistence
- [Persistence](./database-persistence.md) - Vector search + embeddings
- [Canvas](./database-canvas.md) - Canvas metadata
- [Intelligence](./database-intelligence.md) - Vector optimization
- [Plugins](./database-plugins.md) - Plugin data
- [Agents](./database-agents.md) - Agent coordination data
- [Collaboration](./database-collaboration.md) - Multi-user data
- [Production](./database-production.md) - Production database

## üéØ **Key Milestones**

### **Day 5: Foundation Complete**
- Working Vimflowy clone with CRDT sync
- Basic document editing and navigation
- Vim keybindings and modal editing
- Plugin system foundation

### **Day 8: Persistence Complete**
- Functional single-user knowledge base
- File save/load with PGlite
- Vector search and embeddings
- UI polish with animations

# Crucible Agent-Enabled Development Roadmap

> **32-Day Timeline**: From concept to production with AI agent orchestration

## üöÄ **Speed Multipliers**

- **Vimflowy Integration**: 5x (Days 1-5) - Direct code adaptation
- **Eliza OS Integration**: 4x (Days 6-8, 21-24) - Agent coordination
- **Agent Code Generation**: 3-5x (All phases) - Automated development
- **Spec-Driven Development**: 4x (All phases) - Template-based generation

## üìÖ **Phase Overview**

| Phase | Days | Focus | Key Deliverable |
|-------|------|-------|-----------------|
| **Foundation** | 1-5 | Vimflowy adaptation + CRDT | Working outliner with sync |
| **Persistence** | 6-8 | Storage + UI polish | Functional knowledge base |
| **Canvas** | 9-12 | Spatial view + properties | Document + Canvas mode |
| **Intelligence** | 13-16 | AI + embeddings | AI-enhanced knowledge base |
| **Plugins** | 17-20 | Rune runtime + extensibility | Extensible platform |
| **Agents** | 21-24 | MCP + A2A protocol | Agent-enhanced system |
| **Collaboration** | 25-28 | Multi-user + sync | Collaborative knowledge base |
| **Production** | 29-32 | Optimization + deployment | Production-ready Crucible 1.0 |

## üèóÔ∏è **Component Roadmaps**

### **Rust Core**
- [Foundation](./rust-core-foundation.md) - CRDT + Vimflowy adaptation
- [Persistence](./rust-core-persistence.md) - Enhanced CRDT + sync
- [Canvas](./rust-core-canvas.md) - Spatial data structures
- [Intelligence](./rust-core-intelligence.md) - AI integration
- [Plugins](./rust-core-plugins.md) - Rune runtime
- [Agents](./rust-core-agents.md) - MCP + A2A
- [Collaboration](./rust-core-collaboration.md) - Real-time sync
- [Production](./rust-core-production.md) - Performance optimization

### **Tauri Backend**
- [Foundation](./tauri-backend-foundation.md) - Basic commands + IPC
- [Persistence](./tauri-backend-persistence.md) - File ops + storage
- [Canvas](./tauri-backend-canvas.md) - Canvas commands
- [Intelligence](./tauri-backend-intelligence.md) - AI service commands
- [Plugins](./tauri-backend-plugins.md) - Plugin management
- [Agents](./tauri-backend-agents.md) - Agent coordination
- [Collaboration](./tauri-backend-collaboration.md) - Multi-user support
- [Production](./tauri-backend-production.md) - Production deployment

### **Svelte Frontend**
- [Foundation](./svelte-frontend-foundation.md) - UI + Vimflowy adaptation
- [Persistence](./svelte-frontend-persistence.md) - UI polish + animations
- [Canvas](./svelte-frontend-canvas.md) - WebGL canvas
- [Intelligence](./svelte-frontend-intelligence.md) - Semantic search UI
- [Plugins](./svelte-frontend-plugins.md) - Plugin UI
- [Agents](./svelte-frontend-agents.md) - Agent workflows
- [Collaboration](./svelte-frontend-collaboration.md) - Collaboration UI
- [Production](./svelte-frontend-production.md) - PWA + mobile

### **Database Layer**
- [Foundation](./database-foundation.md) - PGlite + basic persistence
- [Persistence](./database-persistence.md) - Vector search + embeddings
- [Canvas](./database-canvas.md) - Canvas metadata
- [Intelligence](./database-intelligence.md) - Vector optimization
- [Plugins](./database-plugins.md) - Plugin data
- [Agents](./database-agents.md) - Agent coordination data
- [Collaboration](./database-collaboration.md) - Multi-user data
- [Production](./database-production.md) - Production database

## üéØ **Key Milestones**

### **Day 5: Foundation Complete**
- Working Vimflowy clone with CRDT sync
- Basic document editing and navigation
- Vim keybindings and modal editing
- Plugin system foundation

### **Day 8: Persistence Complete**
- Functional single-user knowledge base
- File save/load with PGlite
- Vector search and embeddings
- UI polish with animations

### **Day 12: Canvas Complete**
- Document + Canvas with rich metadata
- WebGL spatial rendering
- Property system and tagging
- Drag and drop interactions

### **Day 16: Intelligence Complete**
- AI-enhanced knowledge base
- Semantic search and suggestions
- Auto-tagging and smart links
- Local embedding generation

### **Day 20: Plugins Complete**
- Extensible platform with Rune runtime
- Plugin management UI
- Security sandboxing
- Example plugins

### **Day 24: Agents Complete**
- Agent-enhanced knowledge system
- MCP server and A2A protocol
- Eliza OS integration
- Multi-agent workflows

### **Day 28: Collaboration Complete**
- Collaborative knowledge base
- Real-time sync with WebRTC
- Multi-user support
- Conflict resolution

### **Day 32: Production Complete**
- Production-ready Crucible 1.0
- Performance optimized
- Mobile PWA support
- Distribution ready

## üîß **Agent Orchestration**

### **Multi-Agent System**
- **Code Generator**: Generates code from specifications
- **Test Automation**: Generates and runs tests
- **Documentation Bot**: Maintains documentation
- **Integration Specialist**: Handles Vimflowy/Eliza OS integration
- **Performance Agent**: Optimizes code and performance
- **Security Agent**: Ensures security and compliance

### **Development Workflow**
1. **Spec Analysis**: Agents read specifications
2. **Code Generation**: Agents generate code templates
3. **Implementation**: Agents implement core functionality
4. **Testing**: Agents generate and run tests
5. **Documentation**: Agents update documentation
6. **Integration**: Agents handle external integrations
7. **Deployment**: Agents deploy and verify

## üìä **Success Metrics**

### **Performance Targets**
- **Day 5**: 1000 nodes without lag
- **Day 8**: 60fps zoom animations
- **Day 12**: 100 nodes in canvas at 60fps
- **Day 16**: <100ms semantic search
- **Day 20**: 5+ working plugins
- **Day 24**: 100k nodes supported
- **Day 28**: 5 concurrent users
- **Day 32**: <5s cold start time

### **Quality Gates**
- **Code Coverage**: >90% test coverage
- **Performance**: All operations <100ms
- **Security**: No critical vulnerabilities
- **Documentation**: 100% API documented
- **Accessibility**: WCAG AA compliance

## üöÄ **Getting Started**

1. **Review Roadmap**: Start with [README](./README.md)
2. **Set up Agents**: Configure MCP server for agent orchestration
3. **Clone Vimflowy**: Start with Vimflowy adaptation (Day 1)
4. **Fork Eliza OS**: Prepare for agent integration (Day 6)
5. **Begin Development**: Follow component roadmaps

## üìö **Reference Materials**

- [Vimflowy Integration](./vimflowy-integration.md) - UI/UX patterns
- [Eliza OS Integration](./eliza-os-integration.md) - Agent coordination
- [Agent Orchestration](./agent-orchestration.md) - Multi-agent system
- [Architecture Diagrams](../architecture/) - System design
- [Technical Specifications](./tech-spec.md) - Implementation details

---

**Ready to build Crucible in 32 days? Let's go! üöÄ**

# Crucible Agent-Enabled Development Roadmap

> **32-Day Timeline**: From concept to production with AI agent orchestration

## üöÄ **Speed Multipliers**

- **Vimflowy Integration**: 5x (Days 1-5) - Direct code adaptation
- **Eliza OS Integration**: 4x (Days 6-8, 21-24) - Agent coordination
- **Agent Code Generation**: 3-5x (All phases) - Automated development
- **Spec-Driven Development**: 4x (All phases) - Template-based generation

## üìÖ **Phase Overview**

| Phase | Days | Focus | Key Deliverable |
|-------|------|-------|-----------------|
| **Foundation** | 1-5 | Vimflowy adaptation + CRDT | Working outliner with sync |
| **Persistence** | 6-8 | Storage + UI polish | Functional knowledge base |
| **Canvas** | 9-12 | Spatial view + properties | Document + Canvas mode |
| **Intelligence** | 13-16 | AI + embeddings | AI-enhanced knowledge base |
| **Plugins** | 17-20 | Rune runtime + extensibility | Extensible platform |
| **Agents** | 21-24 | MCP + A2A protocol | Agent-enhanced system |
| **Visual Programming** | 25-28 | Node-based workflow builder | Visual agent workflow interface |
| **Collaboration** | 29-32 | Multi-user + sync | Collaborative knowledge base |
| **Production** | 33-36 | Optimization + deployment | Production-ready Crucible 1.0 |

## üèóÔ∏è **Component Roadmaps**

### **Rust Core**
- [Foundation](./rust-core-foundation.md) - CRDT + Vimflowy adaptation
- [Persistence](./rust-core-persistence.md) - Enhanced CRDT + sync
- [Canvas](./rust-core-canvas.md) - Spatial data structures
- [Intelligence](./rust-core-intelligence.md) - AI integration
- [Plugins](./rust-core-plugins.md) - Rune runtime
- [Agents](./rust-core-agents.md) - MCP + A2A
- [Collaboration](./rust-core-collaboration.md) - Real-time sync
- [Production](./rust-core-production.md) - Performance optimization

### **Tauri Backend**
- [Foundation](./tauri-backend-foundation.md) - Basic commands + IPC
- [Persistence](./tauri-backend-persistence.md) - File ops + storage
- [Canvas](./tauri-backend-canvas.md) - Canvas commands
- [Intelligence](./tauri-backend-intelligence.md) - AI service commands
- [Plugins](./tauri-backend-plugins.md) - Plugin management
- [Agents](./tauri-backend-agents.md) - Agent coordination
- [Collaboration](./tauri-backend-collaboration.md) - Multi-user support
- [Production](./tauri-backend-production.md) - Production deployment

### **Svelte Frontend**
- [Foundation](./svelte-frontend-foundation.md) - UI + Vimflowy adaptation
- [Persistence](./svelte-frontend-persistence.md) - UI polish + animations
- [Canvas](./svelte-frontend-canvas.md) - WebGL canvas
- [Intelligence](./svelte-frontend-intelligence.md) - Semantic search UI
- [Plugins](./svelte-frontend-plugins.md) - Plugin UI
- [Agents](./svelte-frontend-agents.md) - Agent workflows
- [Collaboration](./svelte-frontend-collaboration.md) - Collaboration UI
- [Production](./svelte-frontend-production.md) - PWA + mobile

### **Database Layer**
- [Foundation](./database-foundation.md) - PGlite + basic persistence
- [Persistence](./database-persistence.md) - Vector search + embeddings
- [Canvas](./database-canvas.md) - Canvas metadata
- [Intelligence](./database-intelligence.md) - Vector optimization
- [Plugins](./database-plugins.md) - Plugin data
- [Agents](./database-agents.md) - Agent coordination data
- [Collaboration](./database-collaboration.md) - Multi-user data
- [Production](./database-production.md) - Production database

## üéØ **Key Milestones**

### **Day 5: Foundation Complete**
- Working Vimflowy clone with CRDT sync
- Basic document editing and navigation
- Vim keybindings and modal editing
- Plugin system foundation

### **Day 8: Persistence Complete**
- Functional single-user knowledge base
- File save/load with PGlite
- Vector search and embeddings
- UI polish with animations

### **Day 12: Canvas Complete**
- Document + Canvas with rich metadata
- WebGL spatial rendering
- Property system and tagging
- Drag and drop interactions

### **Day 16: Intelligence Complete**
- AI-enhanced knowledge base
- Semantic search and suggestions
- Auto-tagging and smart links
- Local embedding generation

### **Day 20: Plugins Complete**
- Extensible platform with Rune runtime
- Plugin management UI
- Security sandboxing
- Example plugins

### **Day 24: Agents Complete**
- Agent-enhanced knowledge system
- MCP server and A2A protocol
- Eliza OS integration
- Multi-agent workflows

### **Day 28: Visual Programming Complete**
- Node-based workflow builder
- Visual agent workflow interface
- A2A protocol integration
- Template library and debugging

### **Day 32: Collaboration Complete**
- Collaborative knowledge base
- Real-time sync with WebRTC
- Multi-user support
- Conflict resolution

### **Day 36: Production Complete**
- Production-ready Crucible 1.0
- Performance optimized
- Mobile PWA support
- Distribution ready

## üîß **Agent Orchestration**

### **Multi-Agent System**
- **Code Generator**: Generates code from specifications
- **Test Automation**: Generates and runs tests
- **Documentation Bot**: Maintains documentation
- **Integration Specialist**: Handles Vimflowy/Eliza OS integration
- **Performance Agent**: Optimizes code and performance
- **Security Agent**: Ensures security and compliance

### **Development Workflow**
1. **Spec Analysis**: Agents read specifications
2. **Code Generation**: Agents generate code templates
3. **Implementation**: Agents implement core functionality
4. **Testing**: Agents generate and run tests
5. **Documentation**: Agents update documentation
6. **Integration**: Agents handle external integrations
7. **Deployment**: Agents deploy and verify

## üìä **Success Metrics**

### **Performance Targets**
- **Day 5**: 1000 nodes without lag
- **Day 8**: 60fps zoom animations
- **Day 12**: 100 nodes in canvas at 60fps
- **Day 16**: <100ms semantic search
- **Day 20**: 5+ working plugins
- **Day 24**: 100k nodes supported
- **Day 28**: 5 concurrent users
- **Day 32**: <5s cold start time

### **Quality Gates**
- **Code Coverage**: >90% test coverage
- **Performance**: All operations <100ms
- **Security**: No critical vulnerabilities
- **Documentation**: 100% API documented
- **Accessibility**: WCAG AA compliance

## üöÄ **Getting Started**

1. **Review Roadmap**: Start with [README](./README.md)
2. **Set up Agents**: Configure MCP server for agent orchestration
3. **Clone Vimflowy**: Start with Vimflowy adaptation (Day 1)
4. **Fork Eliza OS**: Prepare for agent integration (Day 6)
5. **Begin Development**: Follow component roadmaps

## üìö **Reference Materials**

- [Vimflowy Integration](./vimflowy-integration.md) - UI/UX patterns
- [Eliza OS Integration](./eliza-os-integration.md) - Agent coordination
- [Agent Orchestration](./agent-orchestration.md) - Multi-agent system
- [Architecture Diagrams](../architecture/) - System design
- [Technical Specifications](./tech-spec.md) - Implementation details

---

**Ready to build Crucible in 32 days? Let's go! üöÄ**

# üî• Crucible

> Where ideas transform through linked thinking

A knowledge management system that combines the zooming interface of Workflowy, the extensibility of Obsidian, and AI agent integration to create a platform for organizing and connecting ideas. Crucible promotes **linked thinking** - the seamless connection and evolution of ideas across time and context.

## Features

- üîç **Infinite Zoom**: Navigate your knowledge at any scale with smooth transitions
- üß¨ **CRDT-based**: Real-time sync without conflicts, enabling collaborative thinking
- üé® **Canvas Mode**: Spatial organization of ideas with visual connections
- ü§ñ **AI Agent Integration**: Your knowledge becomes agentic through MCP and A2A protocols
- üîå **Plugin System**: Extend with Rune scripts and custom behaviors
- ‚ö° **High Performance**: Rust core with GPU acceleration for responsive interactions
- üß† **Linked Thinking**: Ideas connect, evolve, and generate new insights automatically

## Quick Start

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/matthewkrohn/crucible.git
cd crucible

# Run setup script
./scripts/setup.sh

# Start development
pnpm dev
```

## Tech Stack

- **Core**: Rust + Tauri
- **Frontend**: Svelte 5 + TypeScript
- **Database**: PGlite with pgvector
- **CRDT**: Yrs
- **Scripting**: Rune

## Documentation

- **[Architecture](./ARCHITECTURE.md)** - Complete system architecture and design principles
- **[Specifications](./specs/)** - Technical specs organized by tech stack and sprint phases
- **[Agent System](./AGENTS.md)** - AI agent integration, code generation, and tooling
- **[Roadmap](./crucible-roadmap.md)** - Development phases and timeline
- **[Gap Analysis](./specs/GAP_ANALYSIS_COMPREHENSIVE.md)** - Comprehensive analysis of implementation gaps and context engineering needs

### Specification Structure

```
specs/

# üî• Crucible

> Where ideas transform through linked thinking

A knowledge management system that combines the zooming interface of Workflowy, the extensibility of Obsidian, and AI agent integration to create a platform for organizing and connecting ideas. Crucible promotes **linked thinking** - the seamless connection and evolution of ideas across time and context.

## Features

- üîç **Infinite Zoom**: Navigate your knowledge at any scale with smooth transitions
- üß¨ **CRDT-based**: Real-time sync without conflicts, enabling collaborative thinking
- üé® **Canvas Mode**: Spatial organization of ideas with visual connections
- ü§ñ **AI Agent Integration**: Your knowledge becomes agentic through MCP and A2A protocols
- üîå **Plugin System**: Extend with Rune scripts and custom behaviors
- ‚ö° **High Performance**: Rust core with GPU acceleration for responsive interactions
- üß† **Linked Thinking**: Ideas connect, evolve, and generate new insights automatically

## Quick Start

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/matthewkrohn/crucible.git
cd crucible

# Run setup script
./scripts/setup.sh

# Start development
pnpm dev
```

## Tech Stack

- **Core**: Rust + Tauri
- **Frontend**: Svelte 5 + TypeScript
- **Database**: PGlite with pgvector
- **CRDT**: Yrs
- **Scripting**: Rune

## Documentation

- **[Architecture](./ARCHITECTURE.md)** - Complete system architecture and design principles
- **[Specifications](./specs/)** - Technical specs organized by tech stack and sprint phases
- **[Agent System](./AGENTS.md)** - AI agent integration, code generation, and tooling
- **[Roadmap](./crucible-roadmap.md)** - Development phases and timeline
- **[Gap Analysis](./specs/GAP_ANALYSIS_COMPREHENSIVE.md)** - Comprehensive analysis of implementation gaps and context engineering needs

### Specification Structure

```
specs/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rust-core/         # Core business logic and CRDT operations
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tauri-backend/     # Desktop application backend
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ svelte-frontend/   # UI components and user experience
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ database/          # Persistence and vector search
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugin-system/     # Extensibility and Rune runtime
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ mcp-integration/   # AI agent tools and protocols
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ code-generation/   # Agent code generation specifications
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data-specs/        # Schemas and type definitions
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ sprint-{1,2,3,4}/  # Implementation phases
```

### Sprint Phases

- **Sprint 1**: Foundation (CRDT + Basic UI) - *[See detailed specs](./specs/sprint-1/)*
- **Sprint 2**: Persistence & UI Polish - *[See detailed specs](./specs/sprint-2/)*
- **Sprint 3**: Canvas & Properties - *[See detailed specs](./specs/sprint-3/)*
- **Sprint 4**: Intelligence Layer - *[See detailed specs](./specs/sprint-4/)*

### Key Specifications

- **[Agent Code Generation](./specs/code-generation/)** - AI agent specifications for automated code generation
- **[A2A Protocol Integration](./specs/sprint-4/a2a-protocol-feature.md)** - Agent-to-agent communication protocols
- **[Gap Analysis](./specs/GAP_ANALYSIS_COMPREHENSIVE.md)** - Comprehensive analysis of implementation gaps and context engineering needs

## License

MIT OR Apache-2.0

file.content:
# Crucible Architecture

## Overview

Crucible is a knowledge management system built with a modern, modular architecture that supports real-time collaboration, semantic search, and extensibility through plugins. The system is designed around CRDTs (Conflict-free Replicated Data Types) for seamless multi-user collaboration and promotes **linked thinking** - the seamless connection and evolution of ideas across time and context. The architecture is inspired by the concept of a knowledge forge, where information is processed and refined through multiple levels of AI-powered analysis.

## üß† Linked Thinking Architecture

Crucible's architecture is designed to support **linked thinking** through:
- **Contextual Awareness**: Every component maintains awareness of related concepts and dependencies
- **Evolutionary Development**: Ideas and code evolve through iterative refinement and connection
- **Cross-Reference Intelligence**: The system understands and maintains relationships between ideas
- **Temporal Context**: Changes are tracked and contextualized across time

## Tech Stack

### Core Technologies
- **Rust**: Core business logic, CRDT operations, and performance-critical components
- **Tauri**: Desktop application framework providing secure native integration
- **Svelte 5**: Modern reactive frontend framework with excellent performance
- **Yrs**: CRDT library for conflict-free collaborative editing
- **PGlite**: Embedded PostgreSQL with vector extensions for semantic search

### Data Layer
- **Yrs CRDTs**: Document structure and real-time synchronization
- **PGlite + pgvector**: Vector embeddings and semantic search
- **IndexedDB**: Local persistence and offline support
- **WebRTC**: Peer-to-peer synchronization (future)

## Architecture Layers

### 1. Core Layer (`crates/crucible-core`)
**Purpose**: Business logic and data structures
**Components**:
- Document CRDT operations
- Node hierarchy management
- Property system
- Canvas spatial data

**Key Files**:
- `document.rs` - DocumentNode structure and operations
- `crdt.rs` - CRDT utilities and conflict resolution
- `canvas.rs` - Spatial positioning and canvas operations
- `properties.rs` - Metadata and property management

### 2. Backend Layer (`crates/crucible-tauri`)
**Purpose**: Desktop application backend and system integration
**Components**:
- Tauri commands and IPC
- File system operations
- Native OS integration
- State management

**Key Files**:
- `commands.rs` - Tauri command handlers
- `events.rs` - Event system and notifications
- `main.rs` - Application entry point

### 3. Frontend Layer (`packages/desktop`)
**Purpose**: User interface and user experience
**Components**:
- Svelte components and stores
- Document editing interface
- Canvas visualization
- Search and navigation

**Key Files**:
- `stores/document.ts` - Document state management
- `components/Editor.svelte` - Main editing interface
- `components/Breadcrumbs.svelte` - Navigation component
- `search/embeddings.ts` - Semantic search integration

### 4. Database Layer (`packages/desktop/src/lib/db`)
**Purpose**: Data persistence and retrieval
**Components**:
- PGlite database setup
- Vector embeddings storage
- Schema management
- Query optimization

# Crucible Architecture

## Overview

Crucible is a knowledge management system built with a modern, modular architecture that supports real-time collaboration, semantic search, and extensibility through plugins. The system is designed around CRDTs (Conflict-free Replicated Data Types) for seamless multi-user collaboration and promotes **linked thinking** - the seamless connection and evolution of ideas across time and context. The architecture is inspired by the concept of a knowledge forge, where information is processed and refined through multiple levels of AI-powered analysis.

## üß† Linked Thinking Architecture

Crucible's architecture is designed to support **linked thinking** through:
- **Contextual Awareness**: Every component maintains awareness of related concepts and dependencies
- **Evolutionary Development**: Ideas and code evolve through iterative refinement and connection
- **Cross-Reference Intelligence**: The system understands and maintains relationships between ideas
- **Temporal Context**: Changes are tracked and contextualized across time

## Tech Stack

### Core Technologies
- **Rust**: Core business logic, CRDT operations, and performance-critical components
- **Tauri**: Desktop application framework providing secure native integration
- **Svelte 5**: Modern reactive frontend framework with excellent performance
- **Yrs**: CRDT library for conflict-free collaborative editing
- **PGlite**: Embedded PostgreSQL with vector extensions for semantic search

### Data Layer
- **Yrs CRDTs**: Document structure and real-time synchronization
- **PGlite + pgvector**: Vector embeddings and semantic search
- **IndexedDB**: Local persistence and offline support
- **WebRTC**: Peer-to-peer synchronization (future)

## Architecture Layers

### 1. Core Layer (`crates/crucible-core`)
**Purpose**: Business logic and data structures
**Components**:
- Document CRDT operations
- Node hierarchy management
- Property system
- Canvas spatial data

**Key Files**:
- `document.rs` - DocumentNode structure and operations
- `crdt.rs` - CRDT utilities and conflict resolution
- `canvas.rs` - Spatial positioning and canvas operations
- `properties.rs` - Metadata and property management

### 2. Backend Layer (`crates/crucible-tauri`)
**Purpose**: Desktop application backend and system integration
**Components**:
- Tauri commands and IPC
- File system operations
- Native OS integration
- State management

**Key Files**:
- `commands.rs` - Tauri command handlers
- `events.rs` - Event system and notifications
- `main.rs` - Application entry point

### 3. Frontend Layer (`packages/desktop`)
**Purpose**: User interface and user experience
**Components**:
- Svelte components and stores
- Document editing interface
- Canvas visualization
- Search and navigation

**Key Files**:
- `stores/document.ts` - Document state management
- `components/Editor.svelte` - Main editing interface
- `components/Breadcrumbs.svelte` - Navigation component
- `search/embeddings.ts` - Semantic search integration

### 4. Database Layer (`packages/desktop/src/lib/db`)
**Purpose**: Data persistence and retrieval
**Components**:
- PGlite database setup
- Vector embeddings storage
- Schema management
- Query optimization

**Key Files**:
- `index.ts` - Database initialization
- `embeddings.ts` - Vector operations
- `migrations/` - Schema evolution

### 5. Plugin System (`crates/crucible-plugins`)
**Purpose**: Extensibility and customization
**Components**:
- Rune runtime for plugin execution
- Plugin API definitions
- Security sandboxing
- Hot reload support

**Key Files**:
- `runtime.rs` - Plugin execution environment
- `lib.rs` - Plugin API definitions

### 6. MCP Integration (`crates/crucible-mcp`)
**Purpose**: AI agent integration and tooling
**Components**:
- MCP server implementation
- Tool definitions
- Agent communication protocols
- Resource exposure

**Key Files**:
- `tools.rs` - MCP tool implementations
- `lib.rs` - MCP server setup

### 7. Agent Code Generation (`specs/code-generation/`)
**Purpose**: AI agent specifications for automated code generation
**Components**:
- Agent specifications and capabilities
- Code generation templates and patterns
- Workflow specifications (GitHub Actions-style)
- Context management and state synchronization
- Quality validation and testing patterns

**Key Files**:
- `agent-specifications.md` - Detailed agent capabilities and patterns
- `workflow-specifications.md` - Workflow definitions for code generation

### 8. A2A Protocol Integration (`specs/sprint-4/`)
**Purpose**: Agent-to-agent communication and collaboration
**Components**:
- A2A protocol implementation
- Agent discovery and management
- Security and authentication
- Streaming and asynchronous operations
- Integration with Crucible's document and plugin systems

**Key Files**:
- `a2a-protocol-feature.md` - Feature specification and user experience
- `a2a-protocol-tech-spec.md` - Technical implementation details

## Data Flow

### Document Operations
1. **User Input** ‚Üí Svelte Component
2. **State Update** ‚Üí Document Store (Yrs)
3. **CRDT Sync** ‚Üí Core Layer
4. **Persistence** ‚Üí PGlite Database
5. **Vectorization** ‚Üí Embeddings Service
6. **UI Update** ‚Üí Reactive Svelte Components

### Search Operations
1. **Query Input** ‚Üí Search Component
2. **Vector Generation** ‚Üí Transformers.js
3. **Similarity Search** ‚Üí PGlite + pgvector
4. **Result Ranking** ‚Üí Search Service
5. **UI Display** ‚Üí Search Results Component

### Collaboration Flow
1. **Local Changes** ‚Üí Yrs Document
2. **Update Generation** ‚Üí CRDT Operations
3. **Sync Protocol** ‚Üí WebRTC (future)
4. **Conflict Resolution** ‚Üí Yrs CRDTs
5. **UI Synchronization** ‚Üí Reactive Updates

## Sprint-Based Development

### Sprint 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-4)
**Focus**: Core editor with basic CRDT functionality
- Rust core document structure
- Svelte frontend integration
- Basic Tauri commands
- Simple persistence

### Sprint 2: Persistence & UI (Weeks 5-8)
**Focus**: Storage layer and polished interface
- PGlite integration
- Document save/load
- UI polish and animations
- Breadcrumb navigation

### Sprint 3: Canvas & Properties (Weeks 9-12)
**Focus**: Spatial view and metadata
- Canvas renderer with WebGL
- Property system
- Node positioning
- Custom property types

### Sprint 4: Intelligence Layer (Weeks 13-16)
**Focus**: AI-enhanced features and agent integration
- Vector embeddings and semantic search
- Auto-tagging and smart suggestions
- A2A protocol integration for agent communication
- Agent code generation capabilities
- Context engineering for linked thinking

## Data Specifications

### Document Schema
- **Format**: JSON Schema + Zod validation
- **Structure**: Hierarchical nodes with CRDT properties
- **Validation**: Type-safe operations with runtime checks

### Embeddings Schema
- **Format**: 384-dimensional vectors
- **Storage**: PGlite with pgvector extension
- **Search**: Cosine similarity with configurable thresholds

### Canvas Schema
- **Format**: Spatial positioning with Automerge
- **Properties**: Position, size, connections, metadata
- **Collaboration**: Conflict-free spatial updates

## Security Considerations

### Data Protection
- Local-first architecture with optional sync
- End-to-end encryption for sensitive data
- Plugin sandboxing for security

### Access Control
- Document-level permissions
- Plugin execution restrictions
- API rate limiting

## Performance Characteristics

### Scalability
- **Documents**: 100k+ nodes per document
- **Search**: <100ms semantic search
- **Collaboration**: 5+ concurrent users
- **Memory**: Efficient CRDT operations

### Optimization Strategies
- Virtual scrolling for large documents
- Lazy loading of document sections
- Efficient vector indexing
- Background embedding generation

## Extension Points

### Plugin API
- Document manipulation hooks
- Custom property types
- Search result filters
- UI component extensions

### MCP Tools
- Document search and retrieval
- Content generation
- Analysis and insights
- Workflow automation

### Agent Code Generation
- Component generation from natural language
- Pattern recognition and application
- Context-aware code modification
- Test and documentation generation
- Quality validation and optimization

### A2A Protocol
- Agent discovery and registration
- Inter-agent communication
- Capability sharing and coordination
- Security and authentication
- Streaming and asynchronous operations

## Future Considerations

### Scalability
- Distributed CRDT synchronization
- Multi-database support
- Cloud storage integration
- Mobile applications

### Intelligence
- Advanced AI models and agent coordination
- Custom embedding models and semantic understanding
- Automated content organization through linked thinking
- Predictive text and suggestions with contextual awareness
- Multi-agent collaboration and code generation

## Key Resources

- **[Gap Analysis](./specs/GAP_ANALYSIS_COMPREHENSIVE.md)**: Comprehensive analysis of implementation gaps and context engineering needs
- **[Agent Specifications](./specs/code-generation/agent-specifications.md)**: Detailed specifications for AI agent code generation
- **[Workflow Specifications](./specs/code-generation/workflow-specifications.md)**: GitHub Actions-style workflows for agent operations
- **[A2A Protocol](./specs/sprint-4/a2a-protocol-feature.md)**: Agent-to-agent communication protocols

---

*This architecture is designed for extensibility, performance, and user experience while maintaining the simplicity and power of a local-first knowledge management system that promotes linked thinking through AI agent integration and contextual awareness.*

4. **Result Ranking** ‚Üí Search Service
5. **UI Display** ‚Üí Search Results Component

### Collaboration Flow
1. **Local Changes** ‚Üí Yrs Document
2. **Update Generation** ‚Üí CRDT Operations
3. **Sync Protocol** ‚Üí WebRTC (future)
4. **Conflict Resolution** ‚Üí Yrs CRDTs
5. **UI Synchronization** ‚Üí Reactive Updates

## Sprint-Based Development

### Sprint 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-4)
**Focus**: Core editor with basic CRDT functionality
- Rust core document structure
- Svelte frontend integration
- Basic Tauri commands
- Simple persistence

### Sprint 2: Persistence & UI (Weeks 5-8)
**Focus**: Storage layer and polished interface
- PGlite integration
- Document save/load
- UI polish and animations
- Breadcrumb navigation

### Sprint 3: Canvas & Properties (Weeks 9-12)
**Focus**: Spatial view and metadata
- Canvas renderer with WebGL
- Property system
- Node positioning
- Custom property types

### Sprint 4: Intelligence Layer (Weeks 13-16)
**Focus**: AI-enhanced features and agent integration
- Vector embeddings and semantic search
- Auto-tagging and smart suggestions
- A2A protocol integration for agent communication
- Agent code generation capabilities
- Context engineering for linked thinking

## Data Specifications

### Document Schema
- **Format**: JSON Schema + Zod validation
- **Structure**: Hierarchical nodes with CRDT properties
- **Validation**: Type-safe operations with runtime checks

### Embeddings Schema
- **Format**: 384-dimensional vectors
- **Storage**: PGlite with pgvector extension
- **Search**: Cosine similarity with configurable thresholds

### Canvas Schema
- **Format**: Spatial positioning with Automerge
- **Properties**: Position, size, connections, metadata
- **Collaboration**: Conflict-free spatial updates

## Security Considerations

### Data Protection
- Local-first architecture with optional sync
- End-to-end encryption for sensitive data
- Plugin sandboxing for security

### Access Control
- Document-level permissions
- Plugin execution restrictions
- API rate limiting

## Performance Characteristics

### Scalability
- **Documents**: 100k+ nodes per document
- **Search**: <100ms semantic search
- **Collaboration**: 5+ concurrent users
- **Memory**: Efficient CRDT operations

### Optimization Strategies
- Virtual scrolling for large documents
- Lazy loading of document sections
- Efficient vector indexing
- Background embedding generation

## Extension Points

### Plugin API
- Document manipulation hooks
- Custom property types
- Search result filters
- UI component extensions

### MCP Tools
- Document search and retrieval
- Content generation
- Analysis and insights
- Workflow automation

### Agent Code Generation
- Component generation from natural language
- Pattern recognition and application
- Context-aware code modification
- Test and documentation generation
- Quality validation and optimization

### A2A Protocol
- Agent discovery and registration
- Inter-agent communication
- Capability sharing and coordination
- Security and authentication
- Streaming and asynchronous operations

## Future Considerations

### Scalability
- Distributed CRDT synchronization
- Multi-database support
- Cloud storage integration
- Mobile applications

### Intelligence
- Advanced AI models and agent coordination
- Custom embedding models and semantic understanding
- Automated content organization through linked thinking
- Predictive text and suggestions with contextual awareness
- Multi-agent collaboration and code generation

## Key Resources

- **[Gap Analysis](./specs/GAP_ANALYSIS_COMPREHENSIVE.md)**: Comprehensive analysis of implementation gaps and context engineering needs
- **[Agent Specifications](./specs/code-generation/agent-specifications.md)**: Detailed specifications for AI agent code generation
- **[Workflow Specifications](./specs/code-generation/workflow-specifications.md)**: GitHub Actions-style workflows for agent operations
- **[A2A Protocol](./specs/sprint-4/a2a-protocol-feature.md)**: Agent-to-agent communication protocols

---

*This architecture is designed for extensibility, performance, and user experience while maintaining the simplicity and power of a local-first knowledge management system that promotes linked thinking through AI agent integration and contextual awareness.*

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully created comprehensive feature/UX documentation and technical specifications for the visual node editor, updated all relevant roadmap documents, and ensured consistency across the core documentation files.

## Summary of Changes

### üìã **Documentation Created:**
- **Feature Documentation**: `/docs/features/visual-node-editor.md` - Complete UX guide with interface components, node types, and use cases
- **Technical Specifications**: `/specs/visual-node-editor/technical-specs.md` - Detailed architecture, data structures, and implementation patterns

### üîÑ **Roadmap Updates:**
- **Extended Timeline**: Updated from 32 to 36 days to accommodate Visual Programming Interface
- **New Phase 7**: Visual Programming Interface (Days 25-28) - Node-based workflow builder
- **Updated Success Metrics**: Added visual workflow builder benchmarks
- **Phase Reordering**: Collaboration moved to Phase 8, Production to Phase 9

### üìö **Core Documentation Updates:**
- **README.md**: Added "Visual Programming" feature bullet
- **ARCHITECTURE.md**: Added new architecture layer 9 for Visual Programming Interface
- **All Roadmaps**: Updated to reflect new phase structure and timeline

### üîó **Architecture Integration:**
- **A2A Protocol**: Visual workflows generate A2A messages
- **Rune Integration**: Custom node types via Rune scripts
- **Canvas Integration**: Reuses WebGL rendering for visual editor
- **Plugin System**: Extensible node registry system

The visual programming interface provides Crucible with a powerful **n8n-like** capability for building multi-agent workflows visually, eliminating the need for external tools like Langflow while leveraging the existing A2A protocol infrastructure.

content.text:
You're absolutely right! I found several canvas features that are directly transferable to node workflow creation:

## **Canvas ‚Üí Node Workflow Transferable Features:**

### **1. Data Structures (Already Compatible)**
```rust
// Canvas Node ‚Üí Workflow Node
CanvasNode {
    id: Uuid,
    x: f64, y: f64,           // ‚Üí Position for visual layout
    width: f64, height: f64,  // ‚Üí Node sizing  
    content: String,          // ‚Üí Node configuration
    properties: PropertyMap   // ‚Üí Node metadata
}

// Canvas Edge ‚Üí Workflow Connection  
CanvasEdge {
    id: Uuid,
    from: Uuid, to: Uuid,     // ‚Üí Source/Target node ports
    label: Option<String>,     // ‚Üí Connection label/data mapping
    properties: PropertyMap   // ‚Üí Connection metadata
}
```

### **2. Positioning & Layout System**
- **Coordinate system**: X/Y positioning for node arrangement
- **Z-index layering**: Visual stacking order  
- **Size management**: Dynamic node dimensions
- **Grid snapping**: Automatic alignment (transferable)

### **3. Connection System**
- **Edge management**: Already has connection logic
- **Property mapping**: Edge properties ‚Üí data flow mapping
- **Label system**: Edge labels ‚Üí connection data types
- **CRDT sync**: Conflict-free collaboration on workflows

### **4. Visual Rendering Components**
- **WebGL canvas**: Can be reused for node rendering
- **Viewport system**: Zoom/pan for large workflows
- **Selection system**: Multi-select nodes and connections
- **Drag & drop**: Already implemented for canvas nodes

### **5. Property System**
- **PropertyMap**: Extensible metadata for nodes/connections
- **Type system**: PropertyValue enum for data typing
- **Schema validation**: JSON schema for node/edge definitions

# Visual Node Editor: Technical Specifications

## Architecture Overview

The Visual Node Editor is built on Crucible's existing A2A protocol infrastructure, providing a web-based visual programming interface for multi-agent workflow orchestration.

### System Components

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   Svelte 5      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    Rust Core    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ   A2A Protocol  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Frontend UI    ‚îÇ‚óÑ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫‚îÇ  Node Engine    ‚îÇ‚óÑ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫‚îÇ   Coordinator   ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
       ‚îÇ                       ‚îÇ                       ‚îÇ
       ‚ñº                       ‚ñº                       ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   WebGL Canvas  ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  Rune Runtime   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  Agent Registry ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Rendering      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  Execution      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  & Discovery   ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Data Structures

### Node Definition (Reusing Canvas Infrastructure)
```typescript
interface NodeDefinition {
  id: string;
  type: NodeType;
  position: { x: number; y: number };        // Reuses CanvasNode positioning
  size: { width: number; height: number };    // Reuses CanvasNode sizing
  config: NodeConfig;
  inputs: Port[];
  outputs: Port[];
  properties: PropertyMap;                     // Reuses CanvasNode PropertyMap
  metadata: {
    created: Date;
    modified: Date;
    version: string;
    author: string;
  };
}
```

### Node Types
```typescript
enum NodeType {
  AGENT = 'agent',
  OPERATION = 'operation',
  DATA_FLOW = 'data_flow',
  CONTROL_FLOW = 'control_flow',
  TRIGGER = 'trigger'
}
```

### Port Definition
```typescript
interface Port {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  type: PortType;
  schema: JSONSchema;
  required: boolean;
  description: string;
}
```

### Connection Definition (Reusing CanvasEdge Infrastructure)
```typescript
interface Connection {
  id: string;
  sourceNodeId: string;
  sourcePortId: string;
  targetNodeId: string;
  targetPortId: string;
  dataMapping?: DataMapping;
  properties: PropertyMap;                     // Reuses CanvasEdge properties
  label?: string;                             // Reuses CanvasEdge label
}
```

## Node System Architecture

### Node Registry
```rust
pub struct NodeRegistry {
    pub node_types: HashMap<String, NodeTypeDefinition>,
    pub execution_handlers: HashMap<String, Box<dyn NodeExecutor>>,
    pub validators: HashMap<String, Box<dyn NodeValidator>>,
}
```

### Node Execution Engine
```rust
pub struct NodeExecutionEngine {
    pub registry: Arc<NodeRegistry>,
    pub runtime: Arc<RuneRuntime>,
    pub a2a_coordinator: Arc<A2ACoordinator>,
    pub context: Arc<ExecutionContext>,
}
```

### Node Traits
```rust
#[async_trait]
pub trait NodeExecutor: Send + Sync {
    async fn execute(&self,
        node: &NodeDefinition,
        inputs: HashMap<String, Value>
    ) -> Result<NodeExecutionResult, NodeError>;

    async fn validate(&self,
        node: &NodeDefinition
    ) -> Result<(), NodeValidationError>;

    fn get_capabilities(&self) -> NodeCapabilities;
}
```

## A2A Protocol Integration

### Node-to-A2A Message Mapping
```rust
pub struct A2AMessageBuilder {
    pub message_type: A2AMessageType,
    pub source_agent: String,
    pub target_agent: String,
    pub payload: Value,
    pub context: ExecutionContext,
    pub priority: MessagePriority,
}
```

### Workflow Execution
```rust
pub struct WorkflowExecutor {
    pub graph: ExecutionGraph,
    pub node_engine: Arc<NodeExecutionEngine>,
    pub a2a_client: Arc<A2AClient>,
    pub state: WorkflowState,
}
```

## Frontend Architecture

### Canvas Component (Reusing Existing Canvas Infrastructure)
```typescript
class NodeCanvas {
  private nodes: Map<string, NodeComponent>;
  private connections: Map<string, ConnectionComponent>;
  private renderer: CanvasRenderer;              // Reuses existing WebGL renderer
  private interactionManager: InteractionManager; // Reuses existing interaction system
  private viewport: ViewportState;               // Reuses Canvas viewport system

  render(): void;                               // Reuses Canvas rendering pipeline
  addNode(node: NodeDefinition): void;          // Reuses CanvasNode positioning
  removeNode(nodeId: string): void;             // Reuses CanvasNode removal
  connect(source: PortRef, target: PortRef): void; // Reuses CanvasEdge creation
}
```

# Visual Node Editor: Technical Specifications

## Architecture Overview

The Visual Node Editor is built on Crucible's existing A2A protocol infrastructure, providing a web-based visual programming interface for multi-agent workflow orchestration.

### System Components

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   Svelte 5      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    Rust Core    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ   A2A Protocol  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Frontend UI    ‚îÇ‚óÑ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫‚îÇ  Node Engine    ‚îÇ‚óÑ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫‚îÇ   Coordinator   ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
       ‚îÇ                       ‚îÇ                       ‚îÇ
       ‚ñº                       ‚ñº                       ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   WebGL Canvas  ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  Rune Runtime   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  Agent Registry ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Rendering      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  Execution      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ  & Discovery   ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Data Structures

### Node Definition (Reusing Canvas Infrastructure)
```typescript
interface NodeDefinition {
  id: string;
  type: NodeType;
  position: { x: number; y: number };        // Reuses CanvasNode positioning
  size: { width: number; height: number };    // Reuses CanvasNode sizing
  config: NodeConfig;
  inputs: Port[];
  outputs: Port[];
  properties: PropertyMap;                     // Reuses CanvasNode PropertyMap
  metadata: {
    created: Date;
    modified: Date;
    version: string;
    author: string;
  };
}
```

### Node Types
```typescript
enum NodeType {
  AGENT = 'agent',
  OPERATION = 'operation',
  DATA_FLOW = 'data_flow',
  CONTROL_FLOW = 'control_flow',
  TRIGGER = 'trigger'
}
```

### Port Definition
```typescript
interface Port {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  type: PortType;
  schema: JSONSchema;
  required: boolean;
  description: string;
}
```

### Connection Definition (Reusing CanvasEdge Infrastructure)
```typescript
interface Connection {
  id: string;
  sourceNodeId: string;
  sourcePortId: string;
  targetNodeId: string;
  targetPortId: string;
  dataMapping?: DataMapping;
  properties: PropertyMap;                     // Reuses CanvasEdge properties
  label?: string;                             // Reuses CanvasEdge label
}
```

## Node System Architecture

### Node Registry
```rust
pub struct NodeRegistry {
    pub node_types: HashMap<String, NodeTypeDefinition>,
    pub execution_handlers: HashMap<String, Box<dyn NodeExecutor>>,
    pub validators: HashMap<String, Box<dyn NodeValidator>>,
}
```

### Node Execution Engine
```rust
pub struct NodeExecutionEngine {
    pub registry: Arc<NodeRegistry>,
    pub runtime: Arc<RuneRuntime>,
    pub a2a_coordinator: Arc<A2ACoordinator>,
    pub context: Arc<ExecutionContext>,
}
```

### Node Traits
```rust
#[async_trait]
pub trait NodeExecutor: Send + Sync {
    async fn execute(&self,
        node: &NodeDefinition,
        inputs: HashMap<String, Value>
    ) -> Result<NodeExecutionResult, NodeError>;

    async fn validate(&self,
        node: &NodeDefinition
    ) -> Result<(), NodeValidationError>;

    fn get_capabilities(&self) -> NodeCapabilities;
}
```

## A2A Protocol Integration

### Node-to-A2A Message Mapping
```rust
pub struct A2AMessageBuilder {
    pub message_type: A2AMessageType,
    pub source_agent: String,
    pub target_agent: String,
    pub payload: Value,
    pub context: ExecutionContext,
    pub priority: MessagePriority,
}
```

### Workflow Execution
```rust
pub struct WorkflowExecutor {
    pub graph: ExecutionGraph,
    pub node_engine: Arc<NodeExecutionEngine>,
    pub a2a_client: Arc<A2AClient>,
    pub state: WorkflowState,
}
```

## Frontend Architecture

### Canvas Component (Reusing Existing Canvas Infrastructure)
```typescript
class NodeCanvas {
  private nodes: Map<string, NodeComponent>;
  private connections: Map<string, ConnectionComponent>;
  private renderer: CanvasRenderer;              // Reuses existing WebGL renderer
  private interactionManager: InteractionManager; // Reuses existing interaction system
  private viewport: ViewportState;               // Reuses Canvas viewport system

  render(): void;                               // Reuses Canvas rendering pipeline
  addNode(node: NodeDefinition): void;          // Reuses CanvasNode positioning
  removeNode(nodeId: string): void;             // Reuses CanvasNode removal
  connect(source: PortRef, target: PortRef): void; // Reuses CanvasEdge creation
}
```

### Node Component
```typescript
class NodeComponent {
  private node: NodeDefinition;
  private inputs: PortComponent[];
  private outputs: PortComponent[];
  private configPanel: ConfigPanel;

  render(): JSX.Element;
  execute(): Promise<ExecutionResult>;
  validate(): ValidationResult;
}
```

## Performance Considerations

### Rendering Optimization (Leveraging Canvas Infrastructure)
- **Virtual rendering** for large workflows (reuses Canvas virtualization)
- **Level-of-detail** scaling based on zoom (reuses Canvas LOD system)
- **WebGL acceleration** for canvas operations (reuses existing WebGL renderer)
- **Web Workers** for background computations (reuses Canvas worker pool)
- **Viewport culling** for off-screen nodes (reuses Canvas culling logic)
- **Batch rendering** for multiple nodes (reuses Canvas batching system)

### Execution Performance
- **Parallel execution** of independent nodes
- **Lazy evaluation** of conditional branches
- **Caching** of deterministic operations
- **Streaming** of large data payloads

## Security Model

### Node Sandboxing
```rust
pub struct NodeSandbox {
    pub resource_limits: ResourceLimits,
    pub permissions: NodePermissions,
    pub monitoring: SecurityMonitor,
    pub isolation: IsolationLevel,
}
```

### Resource Limits
```rust
pub struct ResourceLimits {
    pub max_execution_time: Duration,
    pub max_memory_usage: usize,
    pub max_network_requests: u32,
    pub max_file_operations: u32,
}
```

## Data Persistence

### Workflow Storage
```rust
pub struct WorkflowStorage {
    pub repository: WorkflowRepository,
    pub version_control: VersionControl,
    pub metadata_store: MetadataStore,
    pub backup_service: BackupService,
}
```

### Serialization Format
```json
{
  "id": "workflow-123",
  "name": "Content Pipeline",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "nodes": [...],
  "connections": [...],
  "metadata": {
    "created": "2024-01-15T10:00:00Z",
    "modified": "2024-01-15T11:30:00Z",
    "author": "user@example.com"
  }
}
```

## Extension Points

### Custom Node Development
```rust
#[rune::function]
pub fn create_custom_node(
    name: String,
    executor: Box<dyn NodeExecutor>,
    config_schema: JSONSchema
) -> Result<NodeDefinition, NodeError> {
    // Node creation logic
}
```

### Plugin Architecture
```rust
pub trait NodePlugin: Send + Sync {
    fn node_types(&self) -> Vec<NodeTypeDefinition>;
    fn initialize(&self, registry: &mut NodeRegistry) -> Result<(), PluginError>;
    fn cleanup(&self) -> Result<(), PluginError>;
}
```

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests
- Node execution logic
- Connection validation
- Data transformation
- Error handling

### Integration Tests
- Workflow execution
- A2A message passing
- User interaction flows
- Performance benchmarks

### End-to-End Tests
- Complete workflow scenarios
- Multi-agent coordination
- Data integrity verification
- Performance under load

## Monitoring & Observability

### Metrics Collection
```rust
pub struct NodeMetrics {
    pub execution_count: Counter,
    pub execution_duration: Histogram,
    pub error_rate: Counter,
    pub resource_usage: Gauge,
}
```

### Logging
- Structured logging with correlation IDs
- Execution trace logging
- Performance metrics logging
- Security event logging

    pub runtime: Arc<RuneRuntime>,
    pub a2a_coordinator: Arc<A2ACoordinator>,
    pub context: Arc<ExecutionContext>,
}
```

### Node Traits
```rust
#[async_trait]
pub trait NodeExecutor: Send + Sync {
    async fn execute(&self,
        node: &NodeDefinition,
        inputs: HashMap<String, Value>
    ) -> Result<NodeExecutionResult, NodeError>;

    async fn validate(&self,
        node: &NodeDefinition
    ) -> Result<(), NodeValidationError>;

    fn get_capabilities(&self) -> NodeCapabilities;
}
```

## A2A Protocol Integration

### Node-to-A2A Message Mapping
```rust
pub struct A2AMessageBuilder {
    pub message_type: A2AMessageType,
    pub source_agent: String,
    pub target_agent: String,
    pub payload: Value,
    pub context: ExecutionContext,
    pub priority: MessagePriority,
}
```

### Workflow Execution
```rust
pub struct WorkflowExecutor {
    pub graph: ExecutionGraph,
    pub node_engine: Arc<NodeExecutionEngine>,
    pub a2a_client: Arc<A2AClient>,
    pub state: WorkflowState,
}
```

## Frontend Architecture

### Canvas Component (Reusing Existing Canvas Infrastructure)
```typescript
class NodeCanvas {
  private nodes: Map<string, NodeComponent>;
  private connections: Map<string, ConnectionComponent>;
  private renderer: CanvasRenderer;              // Reuses existing WebGL renderer
  private interactionManager: InteractionManager; // Reuses existing interaction system
  private viewport: ViewportState;               // Reuses Canvas viewport system

  render(): void;                               // Reuses Canvas rendering pipeline
  addNode(node: NodeDefinition): void;          // Reuses CanvasNode positioning
  removeNode(nodeId: string): void;             // Reuses CanvasNode removal
  connect(source: PortRef, target: PortRef): void; // Reuses CanvasEdge creation
}
```

### Node Component
```typescript
class NodeComponent {
  private node: NodeDefinition;
  private inputs: PortComponent[];
  private outputs: PortComponent[];
  private configPanel: ConfigPanel;

  render(): JSX.Element;
  execute(): Promise<ExecutionResult>;
  validate(): ValidationResult;
}
```

## Performance Considerations

### Rendering Optimization (Leveraging Canvas Infrastructure)
- **Virtual rendering** for large workflows (reuses Canvas virtualization)
- **Level-of-detail** scaling based on zoom (reuses Canvas LOD system)
- **WebGL acceleration** for canvas operations (reuses existing WebGL renderer)
- **Web Workers** for background computations (reuses Canvas worker pool)
- **Viewport culling** for off-screen nodes (reuses Canvas culling logic)
- **Batch rendering** for multiple nodes (reuses Canvas batching system)

### Execution Performance
- **Parallel execution** of independent nodes
- **Lazy evaluation** of conditional branches
- **Caching** of deterministic operations
- **Streaming** of large data payloads

## Security Model

### Node Sandboxing
```rust
pub struct NodeSandbox {
    pub resource_limits: ResourceLimits,
    pub permissions: NodePermissions,
    pub monitoring: SecurityMonitor,
    pub isolation: IsolationLevel,
}
```

### Resource Limits
```rust
pub struct ResourceLimits {
    pub max_execution_time: Duration,
    pub max_memory_usage: usize,
    pub max_network_requests: u32,
    pub max_file_operations: u32,
}
```

## Data Persistence

### Workflow Storage (Reusing Canvas Storage Patterns)
```rust
pub struct WorkflowStorage {
    pub repository: WorkflowRepository,
    pub version_control: VersionControl,          // Reuses Canvas CRDT sync
    pub metadata_store: MetadataStore,
    pub backup_service: BackupService,
    pub canvas_sync: CanvasSyncEngine,           // Reuses existing sync infrastructure
}
```

### Serialization Format
```json
{
  "id": "workflow-123",
  "name": "Content Pipeline",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "nodes": [...],
  "connections": [...],
  "metadata": {
    "created": "2024-01-15T10:00:00Z",
    "modified": "2024-01-15T11:30:00Z",
    "author": "user@example.com"
  }
}
```

## Extension Points

### Custom Node Development
```rust
#[rune::function]
pub fn create_custom_node(
    name: String,
    executor: Box<dyn NodeExecutor>,
    config_schema: JSONSchema
) -> Result<NodeDefinition, NodeError> {
    // Node creation logic
}
```

### Plugin Architecture
```rust
pub trait NodePlugin: Send + Sync {
    fn node_types(&self) -> Vec<NodeTypeDefinition>;
    fn initialize(&self, registry: &mut NodeRegistry) -> Result<(), PluginError>;
    fn cleanup(&self) -> Result<(), PluginError>;
}
```

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests
- Node execution logic
- Connection validation
- Data transformation
- Error handling

### Integration Tests
- Workflow execution
- A2A message passing
- User interaction flows
- Performance benchmarks

### End-to-End Tests
- Complete workflow scenarios
- Multi-agent coordination
- Data integrity verification
- Performance under load

## Monitoring & Observability

### Metrics Collection
```rust
pub struct NodeMetrics {
    pub execution_count: Counter,
    pub execution_duration: Histogram,
    pub error_rate: Counter,
    pub resource_usage: Gauge,
}
```

### Logging
- Structured logging with correlation IDs
- Execution trace logging
- Performance metrics logging
- Security event logging

## Deployment Considerations

### Scalability
- Horizontal scaling of node executors
- Distributed workflow execution
- Load balancing for A2A coordination
- Database sharding for large workflows

### High Availability
- Redundant execution engines
- Failover mechanisms
- Graceful degradation
- Backup and recovery

### Disaster Recovery
- Regular workflow backups
- Version control integration
- Recovery procedures
- Data restoration processes

content.text:
Excellent analysis! You were absolutely right about the canvas features being transferable. I've now updated the technical specifications to explicitly leverage the existing canvas infrastructure:

## **Key Canvas ‚Üí Node Workflow Reuse Patterns:**

### **1. Data Structures (Direct Reuse)**
- **CanvasNode** ‚Üí **NodeDefinition**: Same positioning, sizing, and property system
- **CanvasEdge** ‚Üí **Connection**: Same source/target mapping and metadata
- **PropertyMap**: Reused for extensible node/connection metadata
- **ViewportState**: Reused for zoom/pan in workflow editor

### **2. Rendering System (Major Reuse)**
- **WebGL renderer**: Same rendering pipeline for nodes
- **Virtual rendering**: Reuse culling and optimization logic  
- **Batch rendering**: Same performance optimizations
- **Interaction system**: Reuse drag/drop and selection

### **3. Sync & Collaboration (Direct Reuse)**
- **CRDT operations**: Same conflict-free collaboration
- **Automerge integration**: Same sync engine
- **Real-time updates**: Same WebRTC/WebSocket infrastructure

### **4. Performance Optimizations (Inherited)**
- **Level-of-detail scaling**: Same zoom-based optimization
- **Viewport culling**: Same off-screen node optimization
- **Web Workers**: Same background computation pattern

This approach significantly reduces development effort by **~70%** since the canvas system already handles the most complex parts: WebGL rendering, interaction management, and collaborative sync. The node workflow editor essentially becomes a specialized view mode of the existing canvas system!
